eventmanager

Class GameEventManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • eventmanager.GameEventManager

  • public class GameEventManager
extends java.lang.Object
    GameEventManager handles the possible GameEvents for every GameAction. GameEventManager is to be initialised at the start of the game with setActionEvents. During runtime getRandomEvent can be called to receive a possible event for a GameAction

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameEventManager()
      Default Constructor initialises internal arrays.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      GameEvent getRandomEvent(GameAction action, java.util.Random randomGenerator, GameEnvironment env)
      Method returns a random event from a action group of events.
      void setActionEvents(GameAction action, WeightedArrayList<GameEvent> events)
      Should be run on startup sets the events associated with a GameAction.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameEventManager

        public GameEventManager()
        Default Constructor initialises internal arrays.

    • Method Detail

      • setActionEvents

        public void setActionEvents(GameAction action,
                            WeightedArrayList<GameEvent> events)
        Should be run on startup sets the events associated with a GameAction.
        Parameters:
        action - action associated
        events - possible game events with weights

      • getRandomEvent

        public GameEvent getRandomEvent(GameAction action,
                                java.util.Random randomGenerator,
                                GameEnvironment env)
        Method returns a random event from a action group of events. If no action group events is empty it returns null.
        Parameters:
        action - group
        randomGenerator - used to generate random members of events.
        env - environment to be affected by event.
        Returns:
        random event
